name: Panzanella
description: This scrumptious Panzanella salad is a quick and delicious way to use up day-old bread, ripe tomatoes, and other summer produce. For the ultimate convenience, you can even prep the ingredients ahead of time.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper. Slice the bread into 2 x 2-inch cubes and place in the sheet pan. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and toss to combine. Bake until toasted, about 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 300°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper. Slice the bread into 2 x 2-inch cubes and place in the sheet pan. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and toss to combine. Bake until toasted, about 20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: While the bread toasts, wash all of the produce. Slice cherry tomatoes in half. Cut the cucumber in 1/2 inch thick quarter rounds. Slice the nectarine in 1/2 inch thick slices. Slice the red onion in 1/4 inch thick half moons.
recipeInstructions.name: While the bread toasts, wash all of the produce. Slice cherry tomatoes in half. Cut the cucumber in 1/2 inch thick quarter rounds. Slice the nectarine in 1/2 inch thick slices. Slice the red onion in 1/4 inch thick half moons.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the bread has toasted, pull it from the oven, and allow it to cool.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the bread has toasted, pull it from the oven, and allow it to cool.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the toasted bread to a very large bowl and top with salad greens. Top the greens with tomatoes, nectarines, cucumbers, red onions, and mozzarella pearls.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the toasted bread to a very large bowl and top with salad greens. Top the greens with tomatoes, nectarines, cucumbers, red onions, and mozzarella pearls.

recipeInstructions.text: Add remaining olive oil, vinegar, and salt to a small mason jar or other container with a tight-fitting lid. Close the lid tightly and shake the oil and vinegar until combined. Dress the salad. Toss to coat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add remaining olive oil, vinegar, and salt to a small mason jar or other container with a tight-fitting lid. Close the lid tightly and shake the oil and vinegar until combined. Dress the salad. Toss to coat.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the salad sit for at least an hour to allow the bread to soak up the dressing. Serve and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Let the salad sit for at least an hour to allow the bread to soak up the dressing. Serve and enjoy!

keywords: panzanella, Panzanella Salad, stale bread, summer salad, Tomato Salad
